alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 3:02AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Dense Fog Has Developed In Volusia and Seminole Counties... At 300 AM, surface observations, traffic cameras and public reports indicated that areas of fog had formed across Volusia and Seminole Counties. Visibilities in many areas had dropped to below one mile, and between 400 and 800 yards in some locations such as Daytona Beach, Sanford, Deland and Deltona. If you will be driving in these two counties, especially along I-4, I-95 and U.S. Highways 17 and 92, prepare to low visibility in dense fog. Reduce your speed, use your low beam headlights, and leave extra distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you. The fog is expected to persist through around 6 AM, after which, showers and increasing winds are expected to move into the area and help dissipate the fog.
